summary: In this context, ethylbenzene is identified as one of the volatile organic compounds (VOCs) emitted during the pyrolysis of tyre rubber and is categorized under organic chemicals. The discussion highlights the significance of controlling emissions of organic chemicals, including ethylbenzene, to mitigate health risks associated with inhalation exposure in industrial settings, particularly in the oil industry. The relationship is established through the classification of ethylbenzene as an organic chemical and its relevance to human health risks from VOC exposure.
